content.raw:
Fair enough. Looks like the standard library's StrictVersion class supports a wider range of version formats than `get_version_tuple()`, though it's similarly just splitting strings how we are.

Looks good!

I verified that StrictVersion hasn't yet been removed in Python3, you said you thought it was going to be removed at some point?
